intro: Thespesia banalo, commonly known as the Bornean hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in mangrove ecosystems. Thespesia banalo plays a role in supporting local biodiversity by providing nectar for pollinators.
